title: Modalities of the 2026 meeting on victim assistance and environmental remediation
text:
United Nations 
A/C.1/80/L.57
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
16 October 2025 
Original: English 
 
25-16795 (E)    271025     
*2516795* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
First Committee 
Agenda item 99 (jj) 
General and complete disarmament: addressing the legacy 
of nuclear weapons: providing victim assistance and 
environmental remediation to Member States affected by 
the use or testing of nuclear weapons  
 
 
 
 
 
Algeria, Austria, Cuba, Fiji, Ireland, Kazakhstan, Kiribati, Kyrgyzstan, Malta, 
New Zealand, Philippines, San Marino, Solomon Islands, Sri Lanka, Thailand 
and Uzbekistan: draft resolution 
 
 
 
 Modalities of the 2026 meeting on victim assistance and 
environmental remediation  
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its resolutions 78/240 of 22 December 2023 and 79/60 of 2 December 
2024, 
 
Welcoming the decision contained therein for the Secretary-General to convene 
a one-day meeting on victim assistance and environmental remediation that 
encouraged participants to produce a series of recommendations based on the 
discussions, 
 
1. 
Decides that the formal meeting will be held in early 2026 at United 
Nations Headquarters, with conference services and with the participation of Member 
States, observer States and observers of the United Nations General Assembly, where 
they will share their relevant experience; 
 
2. 
Also decides that the Secretary-General shall invite civil society 
representatives, including from organizations accredited to the Economic and Social 
Council, as well as relevant United Nations agencies, scientists, representatives of 
communities affected by the use, production and testing of nuclear weapons, and 
academia; 
 
3. 
Encourages participation at the highest possible level; 
 
4. 
Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eighty-first session, 
under the item entitled “General and complete disarmament”, the sub-item entitled 
“Addressing the legacy of nuclear weapons: providing victim assistance and 
environmental remediation to Member States affected by the use or testing of nuclear 
weapons”.
